A **xorn**, X, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is the only member of the [xorn](/wiki/Xorn_\(monster_class\) "Xorn (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"). The xorn is an [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing") [metallivore](/wiki/Metallivore "Metallivore") that is notable for its ability to [phase](/wiki/Phase "Phase") through [walls](/wiki/Wall "Wall") while moving, which a character can use while [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a xorn.

A xorn has three claw attacks and a strong bite, and possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

Weapons that use the [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") gain +2 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") against xorns.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Generation

Randomly generated xorns are always hostile.

Xorns are the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") and the second quest monster, meaning that they make up 6⁄35 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Monk quest](/wiki/Monk_quest "Monk quest"). Several xorns are also generated on each floor of the quest branch at level creation: four are generated on the home level, two are generated on the upper filler level, three are generated on the lower filler level(s), and nine are generated on the locate and goal levels.

Xorns are also the second quest monster for [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"), and make up 24⁄175 of monsters randomly generated on the [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest"). Two xorns are generated on each of the lower filler level(s) at level creation.

Xorns are likely to be generated in the [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") of the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") at level creation.

The [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") may create a clone of himself in the guise of a xorn via the [Double Trouble](/wiki/Double_Trouble "Double Trouble") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Digging with a pick-axe or [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock") on the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth") has an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating a xorn on each adjacent square.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Strategy

Xorns have a solid [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of −2 and an extremely nasty bite, and their phasing can make them difficult to evade. However, they move at a slow 9 speed and respect [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"), so they can be dispatched with sufficient caution. Xorns can be lethal to characters with poor AC who try to out-melee them, particularly [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") embarking on their quest: their phasing can also thwart [boulder fort](/wiki/Boulder_fort "Boulder fort") strategies employed against tougher monsters such as [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen"). Avoid using non-disposable iron [projectiles](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile") against xorns if possible, and be sure to take as much advantage as possible of their [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") of 20 and their lack of resistance to [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") or [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison").

Characters trying to avoid xorns at the Castle can exploit their inability to cross water by luring them across the drawbridge and raising it behind them. Xorns cannot be destroyed by drawbridges under normal circumstances due to their phasing - however, if there are two phasing monsters on both squares of the drawbridge (the portcullis and the moat in front), one of them will be killed if the drawbridge is raised.

[Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") looking to [farm wraiths](/wiki/Wraith_farming "Wraith farming") may consider a strategic genocide of xorns so that more wraith-class monsters will generate - they will no longer have access to phasing via xorn polyform, but in return can farm wraiths freely without worrying about graveyards, especially once they retrieve [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica").

### As a polyform

Xorns are one of the most useful monsters to polymorph into for various applications:

- [Eating jewelry](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") for [intrinsics](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic")
- Phasing across difficult-to-navigate levels such as [Asmodeus' Lair](/wiki/Asmodeus%27_Lair "Asmodeus' Lair") or the [Stronghold of the Master Assassin](/wiki/Rogue_quest#Stronghold_of_the_Master_Assassin "Rogue quest") - note that you cannot phase across the boundary between the two parts of [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum"), or anywhere on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane")
- Crossing squares of water without [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") or [water walking](/wiki/Water_walking "Water walking") - xorns are breathless, though you will still subject your inventory to water damage unless you use a [greased](/wiki/Greased "Greased") [bag](/wiki/Bag "Bag") or (ideally) an [oilskin sack](/wiki/Oilskin_sack "Oilskin sack")
- Heading directly to the [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") in the Castle, especially during speedplay and/or with a weak character

Xorns can wear all non-torso [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"): be sure to remove any body armor (including [cloaks](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") and [shirts](/wiki/Shirt "Shirt")) before polymorphing into one. Be mindful of where you are when your polyself is potentially about to expire: In addition to the perils of returning to normal form [while crossing water](/wiki/Drowning "Drowning"), you may find yourself stuck in a wall if you are phasing through one when you return to normal form. If you are returned to normal while inside a wall, you can move out of the wall if you are adjacent to an open square, and will otherwise be unable to move at all - you can escape from being trapped in rock by doing any of the following:

- [Teleporting](/wiki/Teleport "Teleport") out
- [Prayer](/wiki/Pray "Pray") - being trapped this way is considered a [major trouble](/wiki/Major_trouble "Major trouble")
- Re-polymorphing into a xorn or [earth elemental](/wiki/Earth_elemental "Earth elemental")

## History

The xorn first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial bestiary for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and earlier versions, including some variants based on those versions, xorns are subject to a few [notable bugs](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3"):

- Xorns could be created in inaccessible areas, such as outside the [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") walls. This was [bug C343-151](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3#C343-151 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3").
- When a character polymorphed into a xorn returned to their normal form and was in open space, they would be stuck in a [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit") that doesn't exist; this was [bug C343-17](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3#C343-17 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3").

## Origin

The xorn originates from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, where it debuts in the 1st Edition Monster Manual of *Advanced Dungeons & Dragons*. Xorns come from the Elemental Plane of Earth and are depicted as odd and radially-symmetrical creatures: a large mouth sits at the top of their rocky body, surrounded by three long arms interspersed with their three eyes and three stumpy legs. All of their limbs are evenly spaced, and their arms end in sharp talons.

Like many creatures from their Elemental Plane, xorns can travel through ground and stone as if it were water. Xorns encountered outside their home plane are not especially peaceful, but only attack if something else attacks them first or impedes their scavenging. The usual xorn diet consists of stone and minerals, as well as some types of metals - this may explain the unused message present in the code of *NetHack* for eating [flint stones](/wiki/Flint_stone "Flint stone").

## Messages

- The debris from your digging comes to life!

  Xorns were generated from digging using a pick-axe or dwarvish mattock.

## Variants

In variants that incorporate the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") role, one or two xorns are generated on the lower filler level(s) of the [Convict quest](/wiki/Convict_quest "Convict quest") at level creation.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), xorns [hit as +2 weapons](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon").

Xorns are the second quest monster for [Ice Mages](/wiki/Ice_Mage "Ice Mage") and the second quest monster class, meaning that they make up 6⁄35 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Ice Mage quest](/wiki/Ice_Mage_quest "Ice Mage quest"). Several xorns are also generated on each floor of the quest branch at level creation: four are generated on the home and locate levels, three are generated on the upper filler level, two each are generated on the lower filler level(s), and five are generated on the goal level.

Using the xorn polyform to walk through the waters of the Castle moat is a [Bad Idea](/wiki/Bad_Idea "Bad Idea") compared to vanilla *NetHack*: the moat is now full of [amnesia](/wiki/Amnesia "Amnesia")-inducing [Lethe water](/wiki/Lethe_water "Lethe water"). A character polymorphed into a xorn can still use their phasing ability combined with any form of levitation, [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") or water walking to breach turrets safely.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the [Elder Elemental Eye](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Elder_Elemental_Eye "User:Chris/dNetHack/Elder Elemental Eye") can protect against xorns at any level of reinforcement.

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, xorns in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") are [lithivores](/wiki/Lithivore "Lithivore") and can eat stone in addition to metal. Xorns are also [no longer the sole monster in their monster class](/wiki/Xorn_\(monster_class\)#SlashTHEM "Xorn (monster class)"), and in particular they can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into [greater xorns](/index.php?title=Greater_xorn\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater xorn (page does not exist)").

Xorns still make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Monk and Ice Mage quests, and will appear alongside the other random X that make up 6⁄175 of monsters randomly generated there.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), xorns can also eat hard [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem") in addition to metal.

## Encyclopedia entry

A distant cousin of the earth elemental, the xorn has the  
ability to shift the cells of its body around in such a way  
that it becomes porous to inert material. This gives it the  
ability to pass through any obstacle that might be between it  
and its next meal.

Xorns are the second [[quest]] monster class for [[Monk]]s and the second quest monster, meaning that they make up {{frac|6|35}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Monk quest]]. Several xorns are also generated on each floor of the quest branch at level creation: four are generated on the home level, two are generated on the upper filler level, three are generated on the lower filler level(s), and nine are generated on the locate and goal levels.

Xorns are also the second quest monster for [[Wizard]]s, and make up {{frac|24|175}} of monsters randomly generated on the [[Wizard quest]]. Two xorns are generated on each of the lower filler level(s) at level creation.

Xorns are likely to be generated in the [[throne room]] of the [[Castle]] at level creation.

The [[Wizard of Yendor]] may create a clone of himself in the guise of a xorn via the [[Double Trouble]] [[monster spell]].{{refsrc|src/wizard.c|51|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

Digging with a pick-axe or [[dwarvish mattock]] on the [[Plane of Earth]] has an effective {{frac|6}} chance of generating a xorn on each adjacent square.{{refsrc|src/dig.c|444|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Strategy==
Xorns have a solid [[AC]] of −2 and an extremely nasty bite, and their phasing can make them difficult to evade. However, they move at a slow 9 speed and respect [[Elbereth]], so they can be dispatched with sufficient caution. Xorns can be lethal to characters with poor AC who try to out-melee them, particularly [[Monk]]s embarking on their quest: their phasing can also thwart [[boulder fort]] strategies employed against tougher monsters such as [[Master Kaen]]. Avoid using non-disposable iron [[projectile]]s against xorns if possible, and be sure to take as much advantage as possible of their [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] of 20 and their lack of resistance to [[sleep]] or [[poison]].

Characters trying to avoid xorns at the Castle can exploit their inability to cross water by luring them across the drawbridge and raising it behind them. Xorns cannot be destroyed by drawbridges under normal circumstances due to their phasing - however, if there are two phasing monsters on both squares of the drawbridge (the portcullis and the moat in front), one of them will be killed if the drawbridge is raised.

[[Wizard]]s looking to [[Wraith farming|farm wraiths]] may consider a strategic genocide of xorns so that more wraith-class monsters will generate - they will no longer have access to phasing via xorn polyform, but in return can farm wraiths freely without worrying about graveyards, especially once they retrieve [[The Eye of the Aethiopica]].

===As a polyform===
Xorns are one of the most useful monsters to polymorph into for various applications:

* [[Eating jewelry]] for [[intrinsic]]s
* Phasing across difficult-to-navigate levels such as [[Asmodeus' Lair]] or the [[Rogue quest#Stronghold of the Master Assassin|Stronghold of the Master Assassin]] - note that you cannot phase across the boundary between the two parts of [[Moloch's Sanctum]], or anywhere on the [[Astral Plane]]
* Crossing squares of water without [[levitation]] or [[water walking]] - xorns are breathless, though you will still subject your inventory to water damage unless you use a [[greased]] [[bag]] or (ideally) an [[oilskin sack]]
* Heading directly to the [[wand of wishing]] in the Castle, especially during speedplay and/or with a weak character

Xorns can wear all non-torso [[armor]]: be sure to remove any body armor (including [[cloak]]s and [[shirt]]s) before polymorphing into one. Be mindful of where you are when your polyself is potentially about to expire: In addition to the perils of returning to normal form [[Drowning|while crossing water]], you may find yourself stuck in a wall if you are phasing through one when you return to normal form. If you are returned to normal while inside a wall, you can move out of the wall if you are adjacent to an open square, and will otherwise be unable to move at all - you can escape from being trapped in rock by doing any of the following:

* [[Teleport]]ing out
* [[Pray]]er - being trapped this way is considered a [[major trouble]]
* Re-polymorphing into a xorn or [[earth elemental]]

==History==
The xorn first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial bestiary for [[Hack 1.0]].

In [[NetHack 3.4.3]] and earlier versions, including some variants based on those versions, xorns are subject to a few [[Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3|notable bugs]]:

* Xorns could be created in inaccessible areas, such as outside the [[Sokoban]] walls. This was [[Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3#C343-151|bug C343-151]].
* When a character polymorphed into a xorn returned to their normal form and was in open space, they would be stuck in a [[pit]] that doesn't exist; this was [[Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3#C343-17|bug C343-17]].

==Origin==
The xorn originates from ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', where it debuts in the 1st Edition Monster Manual of ''Advanced Dungeons & Dragons''. Xorns come from the Elemental Plane of Earth and are depicted as odd and radially-symmetrical creatures: a large mouth sits at the top of their rocky body, surrounded by three long arms interspersed with their three eyes and three stumpy legs. All of their limbs are evenly spaced, and their arms end in sharp talons. 

Like many creatures from their Elemental Plane, xorns can travel through ground and stone as if it were water. Xorns encountered outside their home plane are not especially peaceful, but only attack if something else attacks them first or impedes their scavenging. The usual xorn diet consists of stone and minerals, as well as some types of metals - this may explain the unused message present in the code of ''NetHack'' for eating [[flint stone]]s.

==Variants==
In variants that incorporate the [[Convict]] role, one or two xorns are generated on the lower filler level(s) of the [[Convict quest]] at level creation.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], xorns [[Hits creatures as +x weapon|hit as +2 weapons]].

Xorns are the second quest monster for [[Ice Mage]]s and the second quest monster class, meaning that they make up {{frac|6|35}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Ice Mage quest]]. Several xorns are also generated on each floor of the quest branch at level creation: four are generated on the home and locate levels, three are generated on the upper filler level, two each are generated on the lower filler level(s), and five are generated on the goal level.

Using the xorn polyform to walk through the waters of the Castle moat is a [[Bad Idea]] compared to vanilla ''NetHack'': the moat is now full of [[amnesia]]-inducing [[Lethe water]]. A character polymorphed into a xorn can still use their phasing ability combined with any form of levitation, [[flight]] or water walking to breach turrets safely.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], the [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Elder Elemental Eye|Elder Elemental Eye]] can protect against xorns at any level of reinforcement.

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, xorns in [[SlashTHEM]] are [[lithivore]]s and can eat stone in addition to metal. Xorns are also [[Xorn (monster class)#SlashTHEM|no longer the sole monster in their monster class]], and in particular they can [[grow up]] into [[greater xorn]]s.

Xorns still make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the Monk and Ice Mage quests, and will appear alongside the other random {{white|X}} that make up {{frac|6|175}} of monsters randomly generated there.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], xorns can also eat hard [[gem]]s in addition to metal.
